content: chain at the start of the new round green marker you may find it useful to place a marker in the joining slip_stitch as that is where you will be working your final stitch of the next round for rounds with 2f on either side of the corner chain these should all be worked into the front loop of the same corner chain 2 rounds below meaning you will have 4 sts worked into the front loop of that corner chain the 1c 1 chain 1c in the corner of the previous round will be left unworked behind read the chart from bottom to top right to left left to right if you are left-handed the chart shows one side of the square repeat it a total of four times for each round work 1 chain in each corner i recommend you place a marker in each corner chain to help you to find it on the following round move this marker up as you work each round you need to work your corner stitches into the back loops of the individual chains not into the chain spaces this is because you will sometimes need to work into the front loops of these corner chains on subsequent rounds … and it looks neater too as it minimises any holes showing in the corners i have added the round numbers to the chart in the position where you should work your corner chains use c1 for odd-numbered rounds and c2 for even-numbered rounds 3 © rosina plane www rosinaplane com chart written instructions round 1 c1 make a magic_ring 1 chain does not count as st here and throughout uk terms 1 double_crochet 1 chain 4 times into ring slip_stitch in beg double_crochet to join us terms 1 single_crochet 1 chain 4 times into ring slip_stitch in beg single_crochet to join 4 sts + 4 corner chain round 2 c2 1 chain * 1c 1 chain 1c in corner chain 1b repeat from * 3 more times slip_stitch in beg c to join 3 sts each side 12 sts total round 3 c1 1 chain * 1c 1 chain 1c in corner chain 1b 1f 1b repeat from * 3 more times slip_stitch in beg c to join 5 sts each side 20 sts total round 4 c2 1 chain * 1c 1 chain 1c in corner chain 5b repeat from * 3 more times slip_stitch in beg c to join 7 sts each side 28 sts total note you may find it useful to leave the corner chain markers in place after working this round as you will be working into the front loops of these chains on round 6 4 © rosina plane www rosinaplane com round 5 c1 1 chain * 1c 1 chain 1c in corner chain 2b 3f 2b repeat from * 3 more times slip_stitch in beg c to join 9 sts each side 36 sts total round 6 c2 1 chain * 1c 1
